title: Vectors - ranking magnitudes of position vectors

content.question: Three carts move along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis. The locations and instantaneous velocities of the carts are shown in the figure. Which of the following correctly ranks the carts according to the magnitude of their position vectors relative to the origin at the instant shown?

choices.label: <math alttext="B is greater than C, which is greater than A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

<math alttext="C is greater than B, which is greater than A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

<math alttext="B is greater than A, which is greater than C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

<math alttext="C is greater than A, which is greater than B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="C is greater than B, which is greater than A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

topic.text: 1.1: Scalars and Vectors in One Dimension

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
